content.description: Follow the two parallel crack systems up the main face to the anchors
content.location: Main face on the tallest boulder on the lower wall, right past Balls Out

content.description: Somewhat interesting climbing on the face around the right side of a very chossy chimney (follow directly upwards). As the chimney begins to end (about 60-70 feet up) traverse right along the face, to a ledge and pull over to the top.
content.protection: Two Bolt Anchors at the top shared with Proper Hygiene allow for the route to be climbed with a solid set of anchors.  Was once a runout trad rte with only limited gear.
content.location: Find the gross looking chimney and start to the right past the vegetation.

content.description: Long diagonal layback to crimps on face, all the way up to the roof.Move left under the roof (undercling) to climb over it, and finish the climb up the face using smaller crimps.
content.location: Directly under the white tree on the edge are two bolt anchors.  Use the tree to lower yourself down to the bolts over the edge and toprope the route.  Please do not use the tree as a toprope anchor.

content.description: The climb uses the same anchors as Tree Beard and Proper Hygiene, but starts to the right, in an overhanging pocket.  Using stems, sidepulls and crimps you move out onto the slab beneath the small tree in the center of the cliff.  Move left just under the tree and join the finish of Proper Hygiene.

This climb begins on a slightly overhanging pocket to the right of the climb Tree Beard and follows the features up the face to the anchors set at the top.  An easy series of small holds litters the upper section.
content.location: The anchors are found at the top of Tree Beard and there is an obvious pair placed at the round out at the top.  They can be used for either route.

content.description: Instead of running out the roof and up the face on crimpy holds, take the right at the bottom of the roof and grab the edge running over the corner of the cliff for a solid juggy haul up the arete/corner.
content.location: Start is the same as Balls Out, and finishes on the same anchors

content.description: This is a thin face climb project with a few interesting sections that are more difficult than the other two routes, as it moves through a more technical set of stems and crimps in the beginning, setting you up for a longer enduro climb on crimps that are pretty small.  Follow the route through blocks and sidepulls as shown in the pic up to the small crack, and then climb left at an angle to the side of the bulging headwall. Rounding out towards the top it finishes on a small ledge beneath the Tower.
content.location: At the base of the Ethan Allen Wall this route is found to the left of the start of EvanEssence. There are some blocky corners at the base to show where the route begins.  A few of the blocks are broken and cracked and make for a decent marker for a start of this new project, which is still unfinished. The anchors are found on the north side of the top of EvanEssence, and require a short 40' tag line to lower off a tree to the staging ledge where the anchors are set for toprope. From the anchors of EvanEssence, walk the top of the cliff over to the next section after the headwall and climb down to the next flat tier.  The toprope anchors are there in a offset line so different sized runners are used, as it can be used for two routes depending how you lay your runners over the bulge of rock at the top underneath the bolts.

content.description: Blocky chunks and crimpy sidepulls for the first 30' and then into a slanted finger crack on a layback to the bulging finish to the top.
content.location: The bolts for this climb are the most obvious at the top, next to the white tree on the northern side.  Both are right at the top of the climb on the flat top ledges, so use one long 2' runner and a 1' runner on the bolts to even them out.

content.description: This is a longer boulder route that requires a rope for the unpracticed, as the cliff is situated on the first section of the trail right after Balls Out.  Follow the arete to the face on the right side of the boulder and up the slab on thin cracks to the top.
content.location: Found along the trail on the first cliff section, the boulder is the largest one along the wall and stands out with a strong arete and a pair of cracks on the main face.

content.description: Easy climbing up to the first of two roofs to navigate around.  Use blocky holds to get around onto the face where the second roof is the crux, featuring razor thin crimps on static deadpoints to climb the final section to the anchors
content.location: The first rock cliff you come to from the parking lot.  Has a ton of smaller face climbs around the right side of this cliff section and smaller bouldering lines up slanted cracks on the left side.  The anchors are found by following the trail up around the side of the cliff to the left and then walking back onto the flat area at the top of the point.

content.description: Next to the Boulders in Ethan Allen Park there is a rock face
